channel.title: Pokemon MMO
channel.description:
So, I'm planning on making a Pokemon MMO. What I'm most curious of is whether or not the community would be interested in something like this, and if there could be any legal repercussions (using their sprites, "Pokemon", etc).
I'd be happy to share more details about the project if you'd like.

item.title: Pokemon MMO
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:10, topic:437961”][quote author=Lin link=topic=540676.msg3964484#msg3964484 date=1333576525]

I’d love to see this. I don’t think there are any repercussions unless you have a profit from the development of the game. I still doubt they’d actually care, but make sure you aren’t charging for any services in-game.

Please, more details!
[/quote]Are you nuts? Nintendo cares a lot about fan games, even without profit. It’s ROM Hacking they don’t care much about.

If you follow through with this Zyle, at least read This so your game doesn’t look like all the other Pokemon MMORPGs out there (horrible).

I haven’t paid much attention to other Pokemon MMOs. What exactly is wrong with them? It just looks like they’re using Nintendos sprites.

EDIT. Scratch that, I see what you mean. Although, since I’m planning on giving people the ability to make their own Sprites, I can’t really control it =.

I’ve made a bit of progress, but it’s mostly back-end stuff, so there’s isn’t REALLY anything to take pictures of.

I’m going to start commiting my source to Github pretty soon (once I have the basics done).

EDIT: I’ve hit a writer’s block. If I was just implementing Kanto/Johto or whatever it would be easy. However, Pokemon is not really an MMO type game. I’m not quite sure how to deal with the maps first of all. They were designed to be played by one player, with one fixed story line. Adding a new, more robust story lines can be easily implemented, but the map size is still a concern.[/quote]The entire world in the Pokemon games are made up of maps, even the overworld. Just use the same system. I’ve made ROM Hacking tools that can edit Pokemon Red, Blue, Gold, and Silver if you want to look at how maps are made. ClassicMap JohtoMap

Moderators: I don’t mean to advertise by any means. However, I’m not sure if he knows what ROM Hacking is or what I’m talking about, so I figured I’d link him to the original topics for each program which includes actual details about them. Don’t hurt me!

item.title: Pokemon MMO
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

That’s why there was a few changes to my design. Instead of it being a “Pokemon” game per se, a more appropriate description would be “Pokemon style” game. How I have it right now, is that the owners of the server can create their own maps, creatures and story-line. Similar mechanics as the Pokemon games. Of course, I would start off with the original pokemon (sprites, abilities, stories, etc) and if I get any notices or things like that, I would simply remove them. It wouldn’t be a big deal, because it would be community driven, and I know there are some very creative people out there (either storyline, map creation, or art).
